INT DOCTOR PARNASSUS' DEN A LITTLE LATER
EXT SHOPPING MALL PARKING LOT LATER
EXT SHOPPING MALL PARKING LOT NIGHT
INT/EXT THE MIND OF DR. PARNASSUS THAT MOMENT
EXT SIDE OF BLACK FRIARS' BRIDGE MOMENTS LATE
EXT PAVEMENT ON BLACK FRIARS' BRIDGE A LITTLE LATE
EXT WAGON ON BLACK FRIARS' BRIDGE NIGHT
EXT THE WAGON A LITTLE LATER
EXT SHOPPING MALL PARKING LOT THEATRE
INT DOCTOR PARNASSUS' CABIN MOMENTS LATER
EXT SUPERMARKET CAR PARK THAT MOMENT
EXT BLACK FRIARS' BRIDGE REAR OF WAGON MOME
EXT OUTSIDE THE WAGON THAT MOMENT

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MODERN CITY STREET DAY
dialogues.text: DR. PARNASSUS and PERCY are performing on a street corner modern clothes. As are all the PASSERSBY who pay them no attention. They look exhausted, like beggars...and very old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seemed as though the Devil, after all... had triumphed... And then... one day....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BEAUTIFUL WOMAN (played by the same actress as Valentin but older with different coloured hair) comes into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the very first moment I saw her, I was head-over-heels in love. She was beautiful, enchanting, delightful, young... But I... I was several thousand years old! How could I woo her? What could I do?

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CLIFF TOP EVENING
dialogues.text: CUT TO a desolate cliff top where PERCY is struggling wit PARNASSUS, trying to prevent him from throwing himself of the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a fool! You can't die! You're immortal! You'll just end up broken, in the eternity ward, and I'll be stuck looking after you! Forever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. PARNASSUS breaks free, stumbles backwards, and pitche out into space. PERCY screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At times like these... the devil is never far away.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DR. PARNASSUS is hanging by his coat, snagged on a branch angled out from the cliff face and held, like a fishing r by MR NICK who has a great grin on his face.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. RIVER DAY
dialogues.text: CUT TO a much younger DR. PARNASSUS and the BEAUTIFUL WOM in a row boat, picnicking, as they float down a river. Th are in love, very happy to be together. PERCY, wearing a blazer, flannels and straw boater is row or punting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The devil granted me mortality again...and youth and great powers. I won my bride. I was in love. But at what price...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat bumps into a submerged log. DR. PARNASSUS tries push free. Several cigarette butts float past. Looking up DR. PARNASSUS sees a man sitting on the riverbank, fishin smoking a cigarette. It's MR NICK . There is a loud and ominous clap of thunder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...at what price....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. PARNASSUS looks haggard. He closes his eyes. He sways drops the paper-weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment the wagon lurches to a stop and we hear frantic banging on the roof. DR PARNASSUS is glad of the excuse not to go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean `at what price'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning back to his Tarot cards) It'll wait, it'll wait. Another time. Something's happened. You'd better go and see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typical! You insist I listen to a story and then you don't finish it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More banging from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go and see!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALENTINA turns and goes. PARNASSUS looks miserable but, almost relieved.    He tur over the next card. It's The Hanged Man. It depicts a body hanging from a gib surrounded by several arcane objects. PARNASSUS studies the card, trying to wring some meaning it - then lays The Hanged Man in the space between the others. He takes a swig from the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: EXT WAGON ON BLACK FRIARS' BRIDGE NIGHT
dialogues.text: The wagon has stopped in the middle of Blackfriar's bridg It's pouring with rain. VALENTINA, wearing some sort of covering against the rain climbs out of the hatch and onto the roof of the wagon. Here she finds ANTON pointing excitedly down into the Tha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incredible! I saw somebody d- dancing in the air.. under the b- bridge..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALENTINA looks doubtfully at PERCY who peers morosely ou from under his sou-wester and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true! There was a sh-shadow on the water, when the lightning flashed...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lightning flashes again. We see what ANTON and VALENTINA see. A shadow, on the wat of someone `dancing', hung by his neck with a rope attach to the underside of the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (triumphant) You see! The d-dancer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified) There's someone hanging there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smugly to Percy) I t-told you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rope! Get a rope!

dialogues.speaker: EXT SIDE OF BLACK FRIARS' BRIDGE MOMENTS LATE
dialogues.text: ANTON is `absailing' over the side of the bridge. One end a rope is tied around his waist, the other is attached to bridge parapet. A lantern dangles from his waist. VALENTINA and PERCY watch ANTON'S perilous descent. Moments later there are two bodies hanging from the bridg the mysterious HANGING MAN'S and ANTON'S. The MAN is hanging by a noose around his neck, still jerk in his dance of death. His hands are tied behind his back ANTON can't reach the MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting up) I c-can't reach him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swing in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANTON shoots PERCY and VALENTINA a jaundiced look and wit VALENTINA'S help on her end of the rope begins to swing b and forth. Eventually, with a big enough swing, he manages to hook h foot around the HANGING MAN who has gone limp. Dead. With extreme difficulty and great discomfort, ANTON pulls MAN close to him, takes a knife from his pocket and cuts MAN'S rope. ANTON and the MAN are now swinging back and forth togethe ANTON'S rope which is threatening to cut ANTON in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arghhh!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've done it! Brilliant!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argggg!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, don't hang about! We're getting soaked up here!

dialogues.speaker: EXT PAVEMENT ON BLACK FRIARS' BRIDGE A LITTLE LATE
dialogues.text: VALENTINA, ANTON and PERCY manhandle the MAN over the par and onto the pavement. DR. PARNASSUS has just stepped out onto the top of the wa Soaked. He's drunk and is swaying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you fishing dead people out of the river? He's dead. Leave him. Let's go. Before the police turn up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes, unsteadily, back inside. VALENTINA and ANTON drag the MAN under the wagon, out of rain. The MAN is dressed in an expensive Saville Row suit. His jacket pockets are full of strange weights and arcane sym have been scrawled on his forehead. He's about 30 years o and very handsome.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The MAN appears to be dead but VALENTINA decides to try t kiss of life. ANTON is made uncomfortable seeing VALENTINA administer t kiss of life and he pulls her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! That won't work. And anyway, you d-don't know where he's b-been. Let me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brings both fists down hard on the centre of the MAN'S chest. Boing! The `dead' MAN coughs, sits bolt upright, spits ou little metal tube and smashes his head on the underside o the wagon, knocking himself out. The little metal tube clatters over the asphalt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANTON picks up the little metal tube and examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What on earth is this?

dialogues.speaker: EXT BLACK FRIARS' BRIDGE REAR OF WAGON MOME
dialogues.text: VALENTINA, ANTON and PERCY drag the MAN from under the wa and carry him to the rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put him in the big trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B-but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't argue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boss said leave him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thought he was dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start to bundle the MAN in one of the travelling tru attached to the back of the wagon. With the body hanging half in half out, ANTON suddenly stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I d-don't like it. It's none of our b-business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what do you suggest, we leave him on the side of the road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANTON doesn't want to answer that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking away) Definitely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALENTINA, single-handedly, hefts the MAN into the trunk carefully places a cushion under his head. An action not missed by ANTON.

dialogues.speaker: EXT DERELICT BUILDINGS DAWN
dialogues.text: The wagon stands, hidden, among deserted derelict buildin All is quiet. The lid of the big travelling trunk slowly opens. The MAN struggles out. His neck is sore, his wrists ache his head is bruised. He hasn't a clue where he is. He tri to make sense of the wagon, the grazing horses, the derel buildings. Some distance away a bizarre, horned and tailed CREATURE involved in a strange contorted dance. Hoping to avoid the CREATURE, the MAN starts to move away is stopped by a squeaky voice behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAN turns around to find PERCY looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose somebody saves your life everyday of the week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (croaking) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can hardly speak. It hurts him to do so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too much like routine to bother with a thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with difficulty) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percival St. Antoine della Touraine et Sansepolcro da Piemonte the Third. If that proves too difficult, you may call me Percy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geographically, in the Northern Hemisphere. Socially, on the margins. Narratively, with some way to go. And your name is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appalled) I... I can't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's handy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PERCY whistles to the dancing CREATURE, who turns and approaches. The MAN is getting very nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any credit cards?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?..Oh..OK... you can have whatever you want.. just don't..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...with your name on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah...right.. good idea. (searching his pockets)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wallet... it's gone. Nothing. I've been robbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sceptical)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't remember. Suddenly a mobile phone starts ringing. They all look at each other. It's in the MAN'S pocket. But, he doesn't mov The CREATURE takes his head off ..it's ANTON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might be for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll know who you are. The MAN still doesn't move. ANTON reaches over and tries find the phone in the MAN'S pockets. The MAN tries to pus him off and find the phone himself. The phone is retrieve but, in the struggle to answer it, it's dropped. A WOMAN SPEAKING RUSSIAN can be heard from the phone. As ANTON and the MAN dive for it, the MAN `accidently' steps it. The phone is crushed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pity.. I speak Russian. ANTON and PERCY glare with deep suspicion at the MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit! I told you to leave him. He was dead. DR. PARNASSUS, holding a cold, damp towel to his throbbin head, appears, coughing and miserable from the wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we didn't and he isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was hanging under the b-bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing Parnassus the noose)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By his neck. Until dead. If we'd had any sense. ANTON produces the bricks with strange markings that were the MAN'S pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found these in his p-pockets. DOCTOR PARNASSUS examines the bricks with great interest. He pulls out The Hanged Man card and compares it's arcane details - a noose, strangely marked shapes like bricks, a metal tube - to the objects found on the MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hanged man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he okay? She appears from inside the wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to man)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to PARNASSUS who is in deep thought)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tried to kill himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his hands t-tied behind his b- back? They all look at one another. Good point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I saw that trick performed many years ago at....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S-somebody was trying to k-kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God... that's exciting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We c-can't let him stay with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We d-don't know what this is about, who he is, what he m-might have done...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (croaking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't done anything. I'm sure. I hope. Please... Give me the benefit of the doubt. PERCY and Anton exchange knowing looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appealing to PARNASSUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father? DOCTOR PARNASSUS, looking up from his study of the bricks noose, takes the MAN aside, looks closely, trying to read strange markings on his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These marks... I recognize them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marks? The MAN wipes his hand across his forehead. Looks at his hand.. confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto voce)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been sent by Mr Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impassioned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't toy with me. Tell me you're an emissary from Mr Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me you've come with a proposition. Tell me what I want to hear! TONY doesn't know what DR PARNASSUS in talking about but grasps the fact that if he wants to be allowed to stay he he needs to play along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God! Thank God! Thank God for that! DOCTOR PARNASSUS takes PERCY aside, shows him the Hanged Tarot Card and indicates the MAN with a nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's from Mr Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No he's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's come with a proposal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No he hasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is not lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What proposal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the card, then to the MAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (croaking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. PERCY groans and tears his hair. VALENTINA is pleased. ANTON is not. VALENTINA kisses PARNASSUS on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: INT DOCTOR PARNASSUS' DEN A LITTLE LATER
dialogues.text: The MAN precedes DOCTOR PARNASSUS in the tiny room. He lo around in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can talk here. Sit down, sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. He does so. DOCTOR PARNASSUS sits opposite him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (expectantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to look on top of it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like your study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cautiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The message?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The message! What's the message? From Mr Nick. What does he want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... Well... That's the problem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Problem? What problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately... I've lost my memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll come back. I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've lost your memory?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just... it needs time... to recover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) You've come here with a message.... A vitally important message from Mister Nick... A matter of life or death... and you can't remember what it is!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at the moment. I'm sorry. It's never happened before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AAAAARRRRRGGGGHHHH!!! BUGGERBUGGERBUGGER!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: EXT SHOPPING MALL PARKING LOT NIGHT
dialogues.text: The wagon is parked in a shopping mall parking lot. The theatre is being opened up by PERCY and ANTON. There are few late night SHOPPERS coming and going.

dialogues.speaker: INT BACKSTAGE THAT MOMENT
dialogues.text: VALENTINA, dressed as `Beauty', is rummaging in a theatre skip, helping the MAN find something to wear for the show There is a slight whiff of sexual attraction in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says you must work... to focus your mind. You can help out front.. sell tickets. Ah, here we are... (Pulling out a full bottomed wig) Try this. You can be `Justice'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAN tries on the wig and looks in a mirror. VALENTINA tries not to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling a face) Exactly. A laughing stock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like the rest of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling out a carnival mask) I think I'll hide behind this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No face. No name. The mystery thickens. I'm going to have to give you a name...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She presses a metal breast-plate to his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... until you remember who you are, I dub thee Saint George. You can save me from the dragon. George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on!.. what dragon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've met Parnassus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mischievously, she ties a chiffon tutu around his waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you are making fun of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALENTINA giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry but, nobody laughs at me without paying the price....ah,ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins tickling her. She laughs uncontrollably, fallin backwards into the costume skip..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We c-can't do it. We...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANTON enters wearing his Mercury gear.       He freezes, GEORGE and VALENTINA rollicking about.       They stop, l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Anton.... what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The show. We c-can't do it. It's your father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? What's happened?

dialogues.speaker: INT DOCTOR PARNASSUS' CABIN MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: VALENTINA and ANTON arrive in the doorway, dismayed. GEORGE hovers in the background. DOCTOR PARNASSUS is attempting to get ready for the show he's so drunk he can hardly stand. He's already put some article of clothing on back-to-front or inside out. PERCY trying to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can he remember! (seeing Man in doorway)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody useless! Mr Nick sends an emissary and he can't bloody remember! It's a bloody disaster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go on. You're drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not drunk! I'm under considerable stress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Percy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No understudy! The audience won't tolerate an understudy! There's only one Doctor Parnassus, and I am he!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Somebody make some strong coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVERYONE looks at George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strong coffee? Brilliant! (sarcastically saluting George) This is why fate has brought us together. Don't worry about remembering... It's all the same to a man on a galloping horse!

dialogues.speaker: EXT SHOPPING MALL PARKING LOT THEATRE
dialogues.text: DOCTOR PARNASSUS is on   stage, floating' on his glass pi apparently in a trance   but,humming erratically. He is f by VALENTINA and ANTON   who stay close to PARNASSUS in c falls. PERCY is in his   medieval costume/one-man-band ou They all look uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a bit low-key) For one night only... raise your sights... encounter the majesty, the beauty, the miracle that's in each and every one of you. Take this opportunity to expand your horizons. It's not too late. Experience the Imaginarium of the great Doctor Parnassus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALENTINA peers out over the `footlights' in the hope of catching sight of GEORGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's George?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's nowhere in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) P-probably remembered he had a wife or t-two back in Russia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALENTINA gives him a dirty look.

dialogues.speaker: INT SHOPPING MALL SUPERMARKET THAT MOMENT
dialogues.text: GEORGE, wearing his `romantic' Venice carnival mask is sm talking several middle-aged LADIES on queue at the supermarket check-out. He's carrying the theatre's ticket dispenser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three tickets for the price of two... That's a fantastic deal. It's a brilliant show. Much better than sex. Much ribald laughter from the flattered LADIES.

dialogues.speaker: EXT SHOPPING MALL PARKING LOT LATER
dialogues.text: The shoppers have gone. The last car drives out of the ca park leaving it empty except for the theatre wagon. ANTON, VALENTINA and PERCY are on their own. PARNASSUS, on his plinth, is asleep and snoring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank G-God... N-not a single customer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's close up quick while the going's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's never not done a show before... Maybe he's past it. (hopefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's time to retire. PARNASSUS groans in his sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking out front)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh n-no! ANTON sees GEORGE heading towards them with a mob of MIDD AGED WOMEN in tow. Bubbling with excitement, the mob arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh look! How fascinating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other WOMEN agree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at her watch) When does the next show start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't a next show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVELYN and the other WOMEN are puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've done all the shows we're doing here this evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we've got tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGE looks hopefully at VALENTINA and ANTON who don't k what to say. We hear a crash. THE CAMERA PANS around. PARNASSUS has fallen off his perc and is now lying on the floor...snoring and mumbling. VALENTINA and some of the WOMEN run forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man's drunk. Dead drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disgraceful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly defensive of her father) He's not drunk. He's got a bad cold....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But being a true professional he tried to keep going, at considerable risk to his health.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALENTINA and GEORGE exchange a quick look. VALENTINA thi she's found a kindred spirit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want our money back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem...dear ladies. No problem at all. I'm so terribly sorry. I can't apologize enough. You can have your money back or, if you like... an extra free ticket. Better yet, two extra free tickets if you buy another ticket at half price. This offer is only available today. The WOMEN look on the verge of taking up the offer. ANTON and PERCY exchange looks. They can't believe GEORGE chutzpah.

dialogues.speaker: EXT CAR PARK A LITTLE LATER
dialogues.text: The wagon rumbles across the deserted carpark.

dialogues.speaker: INT THE WAGON THAT MOMENT
dialogues.text: A large pile of coins with quite a few notes mixed in tum onto a table. GEORGE is emptying his pockets while VALENT and ANTON look on..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow! You took all that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got carried away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying through your t-teeth can do that to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unperturbed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of them were coming tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What tomorrow? We're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Okay, if it makes you feel better, I'll give it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) N-no, keep it. Thanks to you we can afford to buy Valentina a b- birthday cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offended) That's enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANTON storms off. GEORGE looks at VALENTINA sympathetical

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be angry with him. He's a little bit jealous. He's young. Insecure. I'll make it my job to boost his confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALENTINA smiles at George with admiration and approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's your birthday?

dialogues.speaker: EXT SUPERMARKET CAR PARK THAT MOMENT
dialogues.text: As the wagon trundles out of the deserted car park a DARK FIGURE hops onto the rear platform.

dialogues.speaker: INT DOCTOR PARNASSUS' CABIN MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: DOCTOR PARNASSUS is groaning and clutching his head. He h fierce hangover. He pours some powder from a packet into glass of water, stirs it with his finger and knocks it ba He grimaces and shudders. A hatch/shutter on the small window behind him slides ope reveal the grinning head of MR NICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't drink, it doesn't agree with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startled, DOCTOR PARNASSUS spins around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want? I'll do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're man's lost his memory! He's bloody hopeless!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not my man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony Shepherd. Little toe-rag. He used to run a big charity. I wouldn't trust him. But then... you don't trust me do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake! Tell me what you want!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought...seeing you so upset last night...that you needed a glimmer of hope...maybe a little bet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Valentina?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First to five?... You might win. And save her. What do you have to lose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll kill you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that would be something. By her birthday then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What! Impossible!..you've seen the business we're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things are going to pick up. As sure as eggs is eggs. He closes the hatch/shutter with a bang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Too late. He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: EXT DERELICT BUILDINGS DAWN
dialogues.text: Back amongst the derelict buildings the Troupe is resting doing chores. The horses are grazing. VALENTINA sits at a mirror fussing with various hair styl slyly trying to catch GEORGE's attention. PARNASSUS, holding his aching head, sits a short distance away sadly watching her. PERCY is with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five souls.. two days, eh!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh! I'm trying to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That he was a wrong-un. PERCY nods his head in George's direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust in providence, Percy. Remember the hanging man. The cards don't lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... but they sure as hell like being economical with the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO ANTON who is painting a long-stemmed, wooden flower...he comes over to VALENTINA with it in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking away) Don't talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P-please...I'm sorry about last night. I behaved like an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANTON suddenly plops down on his arse in a puddle of mud. Then spins, flips the flower high into the air and, rolli face down onto his stomach, catches the stem with his clenched buttocks. VALENTINA bursts out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must admit... even idiots have their qualities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO GEORGE who is peeling potatoes, badly. PARNASSUS a PERCY come up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George... We'd like to know who you really are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?... Yes. Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may be able to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? What?... How...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PERCY produces a small contraption with wires from behind back and gives it to DR PARNASSUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold this piece of wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't feel a thing. GEORGE takes the end of the wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to put the tips of my fingers on the top of your head. He does so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to relax and try as far as possible to think of nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not difficult... in my condition. DOCTOR PARNASSUS closes his eyes. He seems to be making a effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold your breath. GEORGE does so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, very good. Yes... Yes, I see... I see... Very interesting. DOCTOR PARNASSUS takes his hand from GEORGE'S head and gi the contraption back to PERCY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may breathe normally. The effort seems to have tired PARNASSUS. He needs to sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alas, this technique has its limitations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... Did you discover anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dramatically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name?... What is it? PAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony Shepherd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God! That's it! You're right! Anthony Shepherd! They call me Tony. Tony Shepherd! That's who I am! VALENTINA and ANTON begin to pay attention and gather aro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And... you used to do good works. Something to do with charity I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...That's right! That's right! But how?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an ancient technique of mental divination, but I'm very rusty and it doesn't always work satisfactorily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's amazing! Brilliant! (oddly concerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there anything else? DOCTOR PARNASSUS shakes his head, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's absolutely fantastic! Thank you. Perhaps I'll remember other things. PARNASSUS smiles and bows slightly ironically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charity work? I knew you were a good person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what was he doing dangling under a bridge from his neck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh dear, was that a rude question? Have I put my foot in it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's so strange. And horrible.. it's a complete blank. But I do remember I was involved in some sort of charity.. trying to do good, to make the world a better place, you know...inspire people, give them hope.... (self deprecatingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What an arrogant idiot. VALENTINA looks at him thinking `what a sympathetic perso The sound of a flutey whistle distracts him. ANTON is blo a tune on the metal tube he found on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a superior air)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mozart's flute concerto in G.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, the pipe. Where did you get it? ANTON looks at the metal pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. You're a musician n-now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a musical instrument. May I have it?... Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you s-sure it's yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Positive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. ANTON appears to offer the pipe to TONY but palms it so t when TONY reaches out to take it, it's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's g-gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting shirty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fool around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, there it is. TONY once more tries to take it. Once more ANTON makes it disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (derisively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooooh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton, that's enough. She steps forward, takes the pipe from ANTON and gives it TONY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. DR. PARNASSUS, who's been watching this exchange, looks thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: EXT THE WAGON NIGHT
dialogues.text: PARNASSUS and CO are preparing to move out and do a show. ANTON is working near PARNASSUS and PERCY who are unaware his presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's eating Anton? ANTON pricks up his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in love with Valentina?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dumbfounded)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In love....?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little snake! I'll skin him alive! CUT TO ANTON who winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While you're at it, don't forget the other one. DR. PARNASSUS looks at PERCY questioningly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The viper, the scorpion, the amnesiac boa constrictor. Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite another kettle of fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's ambitious, energetic... a man of destiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ironic) And he's going to help us win five souls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he might. Valentina sees good in him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'd be better off with Anton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO ANTON who's pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps I should offer her hand to whoever helps most in winning the next five souls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO ANTON who looks puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's even worse than the other ideas you've had today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) You're not wrong... Ah, Percy, what would I do without you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a midget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO ANTON as he moves, thoughtfully, away.

dialogues.speaker: EXT OUTSIDE PUB NIGHT
dialogues.text: The theatre, parked outside a pub, is up and running. ANTON, as Mercury, is doing his pitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep no more. Procrastinate no longer. Embrace this once in a life- time opportunity. Let the mind of Doctor Parnassus be the portal to the infinite world of your imagination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the curtain, PERCY is signalling VALENTINA to see DOCTOR PARNASSUS has been drinking. She sniffs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Please concentrate. We've got a tremendous amount of work to do tonight. A great deal depends on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A roll on the drums from PERCY. The curtain rises. DOCTOR PARNASSUS `floats' above the stage on his glass plinth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As old as the universe itself, the great Doctor, versed in every mystic practice known to man, and many more besides, will guide you to your destiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However, the AUDIENCE - a few PASSERS-BY and DRINKERS who have drifted out of the pub for a smoke - aren't much interested in ANTON. Instead they pay more attention to t masked TONY who, decked out in a stylish costume, is work the sparse crowd with his smooth charm. ANTON, irritated, glances back at DOCTOR PARNASSUS who is worried about the lack of customers. TONY is now surrounded by fascinated WOMEN. They laugh at of his jokes. One pretty young woman, SALLY, in particula seems to be smitten by the handsome `actor'. TONY smiles seductively at her. The sight provokes ANTON. He leaps off the stage, grabs S by the wrist and begins to pull her to the stage. PERCY keeps playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) What?... Hey, what you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T-taking you to the heart of your imagination!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANTON is trying to compete with TONY but just can't manag the charm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (good humoured) Oh my god! No way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't regret it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go for it Sal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating friend)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if she comes with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enthusiastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're talking! A few ONLOOKERS cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N-not at the same time! ANTON is still pulling SALLY onto the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going on my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your imagination is a very special place. Doctor Parnassus will make it flower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet he will. More laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll do it together. More laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. T-two c-competing imaginations in the Imaginarium at the same time... it's n-not advisable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stronger imagination will overcome the weaker and then there's n-no knowing what might happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's really stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D-don't be afraid, d-dear lady. You'll be safe with me. Anton sweeps her off her feet and carries her onto the st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put me down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have no fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't want to do it on her own!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only b-because she d-doesn't realize...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of her you silly pillock! VALENTINA, worried, steps forward to try and restrain ANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright! It's alright! Staggering under the weight of the struggling SALLY, ANTO barges into DOCTOR PARNASSUS' on his glass plinth. The plinth rocks and teeters. VALENTINA tries to stop it falling. ANTON, unaware of what he's done, disappears through the mirror as DOCTOR PARNASSUS crashes head first onto the st Crack! From behind the mirror comes the sound of a woman's terrifying, terrified screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALLY! They've got her in there! That's her screaming! SAL! They doing something to her! SALLY! Help, somebody! Help! Save her! Upstage VALENTINA tends the stunned DOCTOR. He clutches h head in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father! Father!

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT THE MIND OF DR. PARNASSUS THAT MOMENT
dialogues.text: Terrified, ANTON and the screaming SALLY are spun through black void clinging desperately to an asteroid as planets stars spin madly around them. Blood-red lightning bolts crackle and crash. Chaos.

dialogues.speaker: EXT OUTSIDE PUB THAT MOMENT
dialogues.text: Out front, the CROWD, larger now, is reacting badly to th dreadful screams. Sally's friends try to storm the stage. TONY and PERCY try to hold them back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Everything's alright. It's okay. Really. I promise you. A MIDDLE AGED WOMAN hits him with her handbag. TONY and PERCY are in danger of being overwhelmed. We can still hear Sally screaming from somewhere within the stag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen. Ladies and gentlemen....please... A DRUNK takes a swing at PERCY, misses, and connects with TONY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh! He falls off the stage and disappears into the angry CROW who begin pummelling and kicking him.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PERCY, desperate, produces a pistol and fires a couple of shots into the air. EVERYONE dives for cover. PERCY, taking advantage of the temporary lull, begins to around, untying, unhooking, and pulling on ropes. The theatre begins to close up as the horses bolt and the wagon clatters off down the street, bits falling off as i goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody call the police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A battered TONY, chased by the enraged crowd,just manages clamber on board, with the help of VALENTINA. The wagon narrowly succeeds in out-pacing the fastest of CROWD. As it disappears down the street, a figure is dump unceremoniously out through the back door of the wagon. It's the terrified SALLY, sent sprawling in the middle of road. A figure steps out from the shadows to help her to her fe It's MR. NICK in his bowler and red waistcoat.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. RUBBISH TIP NIGHT
dialogues.text: A police siren howls as the wagon comes crashing around t corner of a great rubbish tip and clatters to a halt... t horses steaming, sections of the theatre hanging loose, broken..an utter mess. The siren fades into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT THEATRE/WAGON NIGHT
dialogues.text: Amongst collapsed scenery PARNASSUS lies in a heap. The others are struggling to their feet. ANTON is desperately trying to do something useful to help PARNASSUS but, VALENTINA pushes him out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you thinking? Look what you've done. Get out of the way! (appealing to Tony) Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY, battered and bleeding, helps her lift PARNASSUS and manoeuvre him to his room.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANTON is mortified.      PERCY pats him on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better luck next time.

dialogues.speaker: INT PARNASSUS' ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: TONY helps VALENTINA get PARNASSUS comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (babbling) This is my punishment. All is lost. First to Five. One down. Impossible, Valentina. First to five. One down. No people. No time, Valentina. We are doomed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very concerned) Ssshhhh... Thanks, Tony. Leave us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY, nods, leaves slowly. Listening.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. WAGON NIGHT
dialogues.text: PERCY is angrily banging about, trying to repair the dama ANTON is trying to help but, is just getting in the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favour. Take a long walk off a short pier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bugger off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY finds ANTON sitting despondently a short way from th wagon swigging from a bottle. He sits down next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: L-leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing to that girl behind the mirror?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incensed) What are you suggesting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, c'mon...we all heard her screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was screaming as well.   It was t- terrifying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrifying? Why? I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) No, well...you wouldn't. You've n- never been inside the D-Doctor's mind have you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your not trying to tell me that mind control stuff is real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it's some k-kind of scam, d-don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... But I d-don't expect you to g- get it... N-not in a million years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on.. if he can really control people's minds, why isn't he ruling the world? Why bother with this crappy side show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He d-doesn't want to rule the world d-does he?... He wants the world to rule itself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a waste... Tell me about the mirror. What's the point of that, if not to razzle-dazzle the public?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles sardonically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're way off the mark. (taking a swig)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a b-bloody great mystery... wrapped in a b-brown p-paper b-bag enema...or do I mean, enigma... He pulls himself up and starts to stagger off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Er... one more thing....Does `first to five' mean anything to you? ANTON looks at TONY with loathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were the c-clever one. He walks away into the darkness. TONY sits there busily thinking.

dialogues.speaker: EXT RUBBISH TIP DAWN
dialogues.text: The morning light suffuses mountains of domestic refuse. Rubbish for as far as the eye can see. Plastic sacks of various colours, many spilling open. A few fires are burn Flocks of scavenging sea gulls hover and dive, screaming murder. On one of the many pinnacles of garbage sits a lonely fig It's ANTON, depressed, angry, forlorn. The CAMERA SWINGS ROUND to show, below ANTON, in a valley waste material, the wagon.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE WAGON DAWN
dialogues.text: PERCY has spread out the broken scenery assessing the dam In the shadow of the wagon VALENTINA is changing TONY'S dressings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God it's only cuts and bruises. I thought we'd lost you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you hadn't been there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds her hand.    Looks deep into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentina, your father seems in a terrible state. Is it the police? The show? Maybe I can help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what's wrong with him, but if it's about the show...I don't care. I'm tired of it...let the police arrest us. I'm sick of living like this....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks miserable. TONY puts his arms around her.   Hol her tightly to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that. What you're doing is important. Really important. It's just... maybe... it should be done in a different way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is about to kiss her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What sort of "different" way do you suggest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. PARNASSUS, grim faced, head bandaged, steps from behi the wagon. TONY and VALENTINA quickly disengage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello, good morning sir. How are you feeling? That was a nasty bump on the head you got..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beady eyed) "Different?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sir, I've been thinking... It's clear the show's not attracting many people. Forgive me but... I see two ways of tackling this problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either the style of the show is at fault... or the type of audience. I would suggest changing both. PERCY has appeared, dragging a damaged flat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Change the show!? Who the fizzing hell do you think you are?......

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh! He sits down heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry but.. you're not modern. People want modern. Look. He holds open a tattered fashion magazine to a page of beautifully photographed models in a fabulously magical setting. He thumbs through more pages of dreamy images.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is modern. It works. Trust me, I understand this world. (with a wink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kind of mind control. Let's try to meet the public halfway.. the right public.. and in a better part of town. From behind the wagon ANTON watches forlornly.   Alone an unnoticed by the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the filth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The filth. The police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There'll be a better class of police too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll be the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trick is not to hide. Change your colours. Be bold. Go where they would least expect to find you. I think we have been brought together for a reason. I don't believe in coincidence. You saved my life. Now let me do something in return. PARNASSUS confers with PERCY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our time's nearly up... This could be what we need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Valentina)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can be my birthday gift to Valentina. VALENTINA smiles and nods to PARNASSUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then... (with a burst of energy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake let's do it!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay, but what exactly do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... First of all, I want you to give me your money. All of it. What?!   PARNASSUS, PERCY, and VALENTINA look at each oth Then PARNASSUS sees something beyond the wagon...ANTON, downcast, heading off through the swirling plastic bags a flying rubbish... a battered suitcase in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton!   Where are you going? No answer from ANTON. VALENTINA runs after him but, he marches on silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Didn't you do enough damage last night? (pummmelling his back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton... I'm the one who wants to run away! (he slows)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you trying to wreck my birthday, or what? Anton stops, still not looking at VALENTINA he slowly dro his suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. We need you. Moved, ANTON turns to her.   She smiles sweetly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much money have you got?

dialogues.speaker: EXT BOND STREET EVENING
dialogues.text: Close up on Parnassus's glass plinth..now open-topped and sitting on the edge of the stage... full of the troupe's savings. A sign proclaims "Please Take Generously" Directly behind the glass box is a half-globe with the continent of Africa featured. Sitting on top is Percy playing something ethnic but tasteful on a flute with one hand...his other is held out pathetically... a beggar. He blacked up and dressed in rags. He doesn't look happy. He sneaks nervous glances at the glass box of money. The wagon, newly painted in sleek and stylish black and white, stands in Bond Street or some similarly fashionabl street with expensive shops and art galleries. RICH WOMEN anxious to be conspicuous in their consumption of wealth glide past. New signs proclaim `The Choice Is Yours' `The Imaginarium More Exclusive than ever'. The stage, hung with soft,flowing, gauzy fabric, has been chromatically divided in half - one side black, the other white. On the dark side a bloated, sun-glassed woman consuming v quantities of food reclines on an elaborate lounge. She i in fact, a very uncomfortable ANTON in full and fulsome d

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Center stage stands DR. PARNASSUS dressed as a stylized doctor with head reflector. In his hand is a staff with a elaborate sun on the top. He is blindfolded. On the white side of the stage stands the mirror and a stylized Tree of Knowledge with bright red apples. Under tree, and reflected in the mirror, sits VALENTINA as Eve...naked except for a long wig that maintains her mode She gracefully combs her hair. Above the mirror is a sign proclaiming "The Naked Truth". DR. PARNASSUS, peeking under his blindfold, is distinctly uncomfortable by his daughter's lack of attire. TONY, in a beautifully cut white suit, and wearing his `romantic' Venetian carnival mask sits in profile in a dr pose on the edge of the white side of the stage. Nobody speaks. They pay no attention to the crowd. A few women stop, curious. One of them takes out some mon and puts it in the glass plinth and turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (retrieving the money) Excuse me, madam. I'm afraid we can't accept this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman stops, confused. Tony hands her back her money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are here to give...not take. We are here to help those in need. If it's money you need, then here it is. (referring to the glass plinth) If it's the flowering of the soul you need, then here we are but, unfortunately we are booked solid at the moment. But thank you.. I can see you have a generous spirit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY returns to his pensive pose.    The women look at ea other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me but, how does this work? What does it cost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cost? Money is no good in the Imaginarium.   This is a refuge for hearts in need of truth. A place for souls to be purified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long does that take?   I'm running late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madam, why should you care about time? What are your dreams worth in minutes? The women grow pensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are hard choices to be made in life. (he indicates the tableaux)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the dreams of the less fortunate in the world. Do you have time for their dreams? Or are you like I once was...do you just despair? Despair at all that is wrong in the world.. (getting to his feet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...despair at your inability to do anything to change it.. to make it better...I despaired so much at the powerlessness of my own existence that I took the easy way out...the coward's way...I committed suicide! Yes, that's right, I killed myself. Can you understand my despair? But I was saved...saved by a miracle...The Imaginarium...and Doctor Parnassus. He brought me back from the dead. He gave me a new life. A reason to live. He has given me power to dream again... to dream of a better world. During his speech, more and more people have gathered. So are actually weeping. They are press forward putting mone in the plinth. Tony tries to stop them but, they insist. VALENTINA, ANTON, PERCY, and DR. PARNASSUS are astonished TONY'S performance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop pushing!/Excuse me, can one make a booking?/Are you taking bookings?/Stop pushing at the back!/Form a queue!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I'm sorry but, we're booked solid at the moment. A Louis Vuitton-dressed woman (60+ years old)at the back the crowd shouts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that child up for adoption? She points at the blacked up PERCY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to adopt that unfortunate black child. It shouldn't be working like this. It should be in school. PERCY is appalled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's in charge here? The LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN looks around as a couple of POLIC OFFICERS arrive on the scene. TONY spots them too and heads off the LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN she makes towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madam, congratulations, you have been chosen. The other WOMEN gasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come forward and enter the Imaginarium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, I haven't paid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't want your money. We want your hopes and dreams. You may make a donation later, if you wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a rare moment. Very few are chosen. Don't miss this once-in-a- life-time opportunity. This way. Please. He ushers the uneasy LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN onto the stage a guides her upstage. PARNASSUS goes into his trance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me Madam, you're the luckiest woman in the world. The LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN steps into the mirror. TONY hesitates..a moment of uncertainty. VALENTINA encourages with a smile. He steps through. Across the street a clock begins striking the hour. CUT TO the two POLICE OFFICERS who start to move the crow and show on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I think it's time to move on, folks. But on spotting the naked VALENTINA who winks at them, th agree between themselves to give the show a bit longer.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT IMAGINARIUM
dialogues.text: TONY and THE LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN are astonished to find themselves in the romantic, soft-focus, pastel-colour set of a soothing, sophisticated, shampoo commercial. Soft fabrics waft, cleansing waterfalls cascade, rose-pet float through the air, beautiful girls swing from swings attached to clouds - all in delicious slow motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overcome)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... how gorgeous...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: THE LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN takes TONY'S hand and looks at hi meaningfully. TONY, disorientated, takes a moment to regain his composu He smiles and, with an effort, puts his arm around THE LO VUITTON WOMAN'S wide waist. He looks into her eyes. She's love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moans softly) Ohhh... What bliss... and I don't even know your name...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony. How dashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bar or two of tango encourages them to take a couple of intimate tango dance steps. Now gently wafting curtains part to reveal.. down a flowe strewn path and over a bridge... a sleazy motel with a shingle over the door reads: "The One Night Stand Motel". the office window sits MR. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, goodness me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bats her eyelashes at TONY and begins, knowingly, to him towards the motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resisting) If I'm not wrong, I fear you must go alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN pouts playfully, pulling him onwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I want to go without you darling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's one of the rules... One imagination at a time, free from the influence of another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (petulant) Boring.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They have reached the bridge. Stairs descend to a stream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh..look... another possibility.. Below them a gondola rests in the stream as small, flower bedecked barques float past with framed pictures of roman heroes who died young; Keats, Shelly, Byron, James Dean, Rudolph Valentino, Marilyn Monroe, Buddy Holly, Princess Diana... the stream continues off into the distance to a dark, towering Egyptian pyramid. TONY is as bemused as THE LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must make a choice...and... actually, to be honest, I'd strongly recommend this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... Rudolph Valentino, James Dean, Princess Di?... all these people... they're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking fast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. To be reborn, first you must die. All of them have achieved a kind of immortality. And we love them all the more for it. They won't get old or fat. They won't get sick or feeble. They are beyond fear. They are forever young. They are gods. And you can join them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softening)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're such a wonderful speaker. The gondola awaits....with a beautiful male model at the helm. THE LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not a moment to lose. But as she hesitates a dark shadow rises over them. TONY, looking past the WOMAN"S shoulder, sees the dark waters o the stream rise up transforming into a GIGANTIC KING COBR that towers menacingly over them. It's wearing a BOWLER HAT... and it's angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But your sacrifice must be pure. You have to let go of all these worldly goods. He helps THE LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN remove her necklace, earrings, bracelets, rings, broach, in double quick time guides her onto the gondola, blowing a kiss after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember nothing is permanent... not even death. He turns back to see the GIGANTIC KING COBRA shrinking ba below the bridge, transforming itself back into the water the stream. From under the arch of the bridge hangs a rop At its end.. a hangman's noose. TONY stares at it darkly disconcerted.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STAGE EVENING
dialogues.text: TONY re-enters the stage through the mirror, looking at D PARNASSUS who has just come out of his trance with astonishment

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gobsmacked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was so... I had no idea... It's just... incredible. ...And then he realizes the clock is still striking the h realizing that only a few moments have passed since he entered the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..how do you do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him and with a big theatrical gesture)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hooplah! The LOUIS VUITTON woman reappears, sitting on a cut-out c descending from the ceiling of the stage. She looks radia She is weeping, completely overcome by her experience. PARNASSUS steps forward and helps her to her feet. She ki his hands in gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, thank you, that was so beautiful, I feel so... thank you so much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (graciously) Thank YOU, dear Lady, you give me strength to continue

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Born again, tearful but transcendent, the LOUIS VUITTON W produces her cheque book and begins to write a cheque. TONY is frozen, confused. The crowd is still... stunned b the LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN's transformation as she deposits cheque, her handbag, her expensive coat in the glass box glides benignly through the crowd... which parts in awe. Pause... and then the other WOMEN rush the stage. Mayhem narrowly averted as TONY and PERCY manage to coral them i a more-or-less orderly queue. Across the street, standing in the doorway of a shop sell luxury goods, is MR NICK. He watches events, intrigued... ...as TONY escorts a second woman through the mirror, and third, they descend, ecstatic, emptying the contents of t handbags, their pearls, earrings and diamond rings into t glass box. TONY pays off the cops who move on. TONY, getting more and more flamboyant, forgets to lower mask each time he re-enters the stage. And now a fourth w descends. Four successes for DOCTOR PARNASSUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside to Percy) One more to go and we're free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTOR PARNASSUS spots MR NICK across the street, smiles, holds up four fingers. MR NICK gives a little `I'm not impressed' smirk and turn away and pretends to be interested in the luxury goods in shop window as four large dark heavy RUSSIAN MEN, all lad with luxury shopping walk past. One of the RUSSIANS stops..looking at the show..at TONY w mask is sitting on top of his head. The leading RUSSIAN pulls him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon..What are you watching that crap for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at TONY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you talking about? (following SERGE's pointed finger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure. They start pushing through the crowd. TONY, reaching down to help an elderly lady up to the sta looks up and sees the RUSSIANS heading through the crowd. Panic!! He pulls the mask down and begins to back up. But it's too late, they've definitely seen him. He spins around and rockets upstage, past DR. PARNASSUS w is deep into his trance. TONY dives through the mirror much to the amazement of VALENTINA, ANTON, PERCY. The RUSSIANS chase after him, shoving the queuing WOMEN aside, smashing the scenery and knocking ANTON into the wings.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT SHAMPOO COMMERCIAL LANDSCAPE
dialogues.text: The RUSSIANS charge through the shampoo-commercial landsc No TONY.. Just slo-mo fashion models and soft wafting fab and aromatic breezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did he go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me... It can't be him. He's dead. We killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why did he run?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, TONY is hiding behind some billowing fab On being spotted, he takes off up a hill. The RUSSIANS race toward the hill only to crash into a so wall - painted as a landscape with TONY frozen in mid str Looking off to their right they see Tony heading up anoth hill. But as they rush in that direction another wall ris up blocking them. Again it is painted with a hill and TON frozen in midstride. A third and fourth wall rise up.. surrounding and trapping the RUSSIANS. There is a cell door in one wall. Like crazy animals they start throwing themselves against the door trying to brea down. It won't budge. While the others batter the door, GREGOR, who has been somewhat affected by the soft shampoo commercial world, s quietly in a corner picking pretty flowers. Exhausted, the other RUSSIANS collapse on the ground. GREGOR gently breathes in the aroma of the flowers and exhales. As he does the door swings open. The other RUSSI gape at him... then barrel out the door. Outside is a new, beautiful, landscape - the sky dotted w white fluffy clouds. Extending from the ground to each cl is an incredibly long ladder. On each ladder is a person climbing upwards. The RUSSIANS spot Tony. He is already a hundred feet up a ladder and climbing. Unfortunately, their way is blocked by an over-bright, hy active, wide-eyed sales girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi! Hello! Today's special! Reach for the clouds! Discover your true potential! Gift certificates are available at...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RUSSIANS roughly shove her aside.     As they rush pa GREGOR pauses, hands her his flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax...smell the flowers.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Reaching the base of TONY'S ladder, the RUSSIANS start climbing. Seeing the threat, TONY kicks hard and breaks the rungs b him.. setting off a domino effect with more rungs breakin downward towards the RUSSIANS. Snap! Crack! Rungs break i their grasp.. they fall. The RUSSIANS land in a tangled heap as the domino effect continues down to the base of the ladder. Laughing down at them, TONY turns to continue climbing - to see the domino effect heading down from the top of the ladder... towards him. THE LADDER COMPLETELY SEPARATES IN TWO. Tony struggles to maintain his balance - and somehow mana to get his feet on the two halves of a broken rung. Then, if he were on giant stilts, starts to stride away. The RUSSIANS chase after him but, his giant strides leave them far behind. Smugly, TONY looks back just as one of t legs of his ladder snags on a fallen log. He loses his balance... and plunges hundreds of feet earthward. From nowhere, ANTON (still dressed as a fat woman) appear running to catch the plummeting TONY. He does and Whomp!! is flattened. Knocked out cold. TONY is unscathed.. his f broken by ANTON'S padding. But, the RUSSIANS arrive, grab TONY, start to beat him up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thieving scumbag! We break every bone in your body! They scrawl strange symbols on TONY'S forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Wait! I can explain! Give me a chance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want our money or you die again! This time for good! ANTON struggles to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! L-leave him alone!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The RUSSIANS turn and, thinking ANTON is a fat, bossy, mi aged woman, hesitate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand b-back! I'm warning you! Foolishly, he whips off his wig and assumes a manly marti arts pose. The RUSSIANS look at each other. Then, utterly ignoring ANTON, turn their attention back to beating TONY GREGOR walks calmly over to ANTON who is in attack mode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bending down and picking a flower, he offers it to ANTON)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. Smell the flowers. Confused, ANTON takes the flower, sniffs and then... GREG floors him with a powerful punch on the nose Meanwhile, the RUSSIANS have a noose around TONY's neck a have looped the rope over a tree branch. TONY struggles t pull out the metal pipe he keeps on a string around his n He gets it to his mouth as if to swallow it when... ... the ground erupts and a giant London policeman's helm rises up (we are talking 20 feet tall)and revolves - revealing DR. PARNASSUS' carved and painted face beneath. The mouth drops open and a great red tongue rolls out lik welcoming red carpet. From inside the giant mouth a smili policeman beckons the RUSSIANS to come on in.. The terrified RUSSIANS let go of the lynching rope. TONY drops to the ground and, with a whistle, the brass p flies out of his mouth. Behind the RUSSIANS a painted backdrop unfurls..it reads "JOIN THE FUZZ.. WE LOVE VIOLENCE".. and a chorus line of LONG-LEGGED GIRLS in mini-skirted police outfits appear - high-kicking a snappy song and dance number. The astonished RUSSIANS don't know what the fuck is going Suddenly, a friendly OLD WOMAN'S VOICE is heard shouting something in Russian. Spinning around, the RUSSIANS see an old BABOUSHKA (Russi grandmother) outside a tumble-down cottage waving gaily t them. A stunned pause. Then, pell-mell, they rush to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama!   Mama! Help! Save us! As they run toward her they get smaller and smaller. She lifts her skirts and all four disappear underneath. And then.. BOOM!.. a muffled explosion balloons the skirts outward. Smoke spews out from below. Straightening her skirt, the BABOUSHKA looks up, and pull off her head - revealing MR.NICK's tiny head poking out o the collar. He smiles smugly. The giant POLICEMAN DR. PARNASSUS registers disappointmen and, like a balloon rapidly deflating, spins off into the sending up a cloud of dust obscuring everything. The dust clears and TONY and ANTON find themselves in a desolate, empty landscape. Nowhere. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see me!! I almost reached the clouds! I could have...it was incredible...I was almost there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Over a distant rise the wagon appears, pulled by the hors ANTON drags Tony, babbling and stumbling, towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made my choice and I climbed... I felt so much potential. I could have done anything. I have to have another chance...another go...I need this...

dialogues.speaker: EXT SOMEWHERE DOWN RIVER
dialogues.text: The wagon is parked on waste ground. It looms out of nowh illuminated by a light leaking from within. We hear PERCY'S angry voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you were holding them upside down.
