dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That cards! The bloody Tarot cards!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distraught and angry) Enough, Percy! Enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made a mistake. A big mistake. I know that and I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: INT THE STAGE
dialogues.text: The angry troupe huddles amongst the clutter of props and jumbled scenery. TONY is on trial. DR. PARNASSUS is sitting in a corner, head in hands. He s utterly destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a l-liar. You've been lying to us all along. Who are you? Who were those thugs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not a liar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I just... didn't divulge everything I knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comes to the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not. Not in law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stole their money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what they said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to believe them before you believe me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they're irredeemably bad people, and I'm essentially good. I know that sounds terribly prim and arrogant and self righteous, but I'm trying to be honest. Look, the truth is... in order to get my charity off the ground I needed capital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANTON looks askance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in response to Anton) Yes, I know, and you're right, but that's the way the grown-up..the real world works. You can't make omelettes without soiling your hands. Or should that be the other way round? Anyway, I - with hindsight very foolishly - accepted a loan from people who seemed to me, at the time, to be very decent and sincere. There was absolutely no way I could have known that they were part of a ruthless organised crime syndicate and that they wanted to use my charity to launder money. I made a mistake. And I have to live with that. I'm sorry. What more can I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALENTINA wants to believe TONY. ANTON and PERCY don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distressed but basically sympathetic) Oh Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, can we not talk about me for a moment.. I want to thank the Doctor for letting me experience the most sublime, inspiring ....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why were they trying to k-kill you? "Again!" is what they said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering his own question)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first time they hung you from the b-bridge... right?... B-because you stole their money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop saying that! I didn't steal it! I didn't have it. I'd had to invest in infrastructure. I needed more time. When you run a charity you have to give lots of money away. You wouldn't believe the red tape. The Charity Commission are a bunch of fascists. It's incredible. I mean... c'mon give me a break...I almost died today.. and I said I'm sorry... and anyway..... this was supposed to be a special day...it's Valentina's birthday. He pulls out the LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN'S beautiful necklace from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy birthday. For a beautiful woman. He puts it around Valentina's neck. VALENTINA smiles.   A glowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marks on your face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They scrawled something on your forehead. Symbols... Signs... TONY looks uncomfortable, tries to rub his forehead clean

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had some of those when we rescued you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, what's that about? But, before he can say anything, there's a knock on the d which startles everyone. They exchange looks. DR. PARNASSUS is frightened but hides this from the other The knock is repeated. PERCY starts to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto voce)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Leave it! PERCY sits down. The knock comes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto voce to the DR. PARNASSUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto voce)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late... for visitors. Once more someone knocks. Everyone is edgy. Particularly PERCY. The knock comes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto voce, agitated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please can we answer the door? I can't stand not answering the door, or the telephone, or whatever. It's not in my nature. I won't sleep for weeks if we don't answer the door! Sorry! DR. PARNASSUS gets up, goes to the door, opens it and ste outside, closing the door behind him. VALENTINA, ANTON, PERCY and TONY exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I just... I've got a thing about...

dialogues.speaker: EXT OUTSIDE THE WAGON THAT MOMENT
dialogues.text: DR. PARNASSUS and MR NICK move away from the door and go around to the front. The stage is half-opened. The horses are standing steaming nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know... It's over....you've won...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four rotten Russkies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the girl..from the pub. MR NICK shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally doesn't count.    Do you, gal? SALLY (the woman thrown out from the wagon as they escape from the pub mob) steps out of the shadows, puts her arms around NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're joking... toying with me. Like a cat with a mouse... As is your privilege.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal didn't get to make a real choice. You were gaga. Out for the count. Wouldn't be fair...And you've got four, thanks to your friend Tony. So... we're even... it's not quite over. He smiles, lights a cigarette, takes a deep drag...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not quite. (checks his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh,oh, look at the time...it's 11.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ...and he wanders off into the darkness with SALLY. Somewhere, a clock strikes 11. DR. PARNASSUS, agitated, watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. PARNASSUS looks round to find VALENTINA standing next him. He starts to round up the horses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentina... my darling girl. We must do another show! Now! Quickly! Get ready to move out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody asking the way. Where's Tony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I overheard you... He wasn't asking the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please! Get everybody together. Another show! Tony! Percy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (harnessing the horses) Not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, now! I want to know the truth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you hiding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are more important things, at this moment!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's something to do with that bloody rambling story you were telling me the night we found Tony isn't it? PARNASSUS sighs. Stops. He checks his watch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I told you was... the truth. I really am thousands of years old. I have been immortal. I have been mortal. And I have had many dealings with the devil. Too many.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fearful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember the woman I was telling you about?.. the one I was so desperately in love with.. so in love that I made a deal with the devil? That was your mother... ...she was so beautiful, so enchanting...so... Looking at VALENTINA, DR. PARNASSUS sees her morph into t BEAUTIFUL WOMAN appearing. He almost swoons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... so young. She was everything I had ever dreamed of. I made a choice. I bargained away my immortality. I regained my youth... and I won her. I did! I won her...! The BEAUTIFUL WOMAN morphs back into VALENTINA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but at a price... DR. PARNASSUS looks haggard. He closes his eyes. He sways loses his balance.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: VALENTINA stops him from falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What price?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anguished)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too terrible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... The price of my obsession... (he groans)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was mortal again... on condition that... any children I fathered... would, on their sixteenth birthday... belong to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him?... VALENTINA can't take it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... didn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother never knew. She died before I had to tell her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this! It can't be true. It's just another of your wretched stories... A cruel story!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If only...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you say these things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true. Every word. But all is not lost. VALENTINA looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feverishly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new wager... The first of five. If I win... you're free... you're mine again.. and we can win! Where's Tony? We can still win!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By playing games with the devil!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With one more show. The day isn't over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All my life you've made me play `Beauty', `Truth', `Justice'... filled my head with dreams and high ideals. All that crap! While... all the time...! The devil was right! You're arrogant! Vain and arrogant! I'm just another one of your stupid wagers!... You're beneath contempt. She rushes off into the dark night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentina! That's not true! It's not like that! Wait! Come back! Valentina! A dark silhouette stands in the shadow of the wagon. It's TONY. What has he heard?

dialogues.speaker: INT THE WAGON MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: DR. PARNASSUS rushes into the wagon. PERCY is already on his feet, having heard the DOCTOR shouting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentina... She's... she's gone... ANTON rushes out. PERCY stops by DR. PARNASSUS before he exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Telling the truth... Always a bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: SCENES NIGHT
dialogues.text: ANTON, running, calling for VALENTINA. PERCY is scouring the area on horseback. ANTON running though a newspaper-filled tip, sees a headl on one of the newspapers. Stops.

dialogues.speaker: EXT THE WAGON A LITTLE LATER
dialogues.text: PARNASSUS, a bottle in his hand, is lurching around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fool! You monstrous fool!    You should be dead. He starts to violently bang his head against the side of wagon. Suddenly the stage begins to unfold. PARNASSUS looks up, unable to see what or who is doing this. He drunkenly stumbles around the side to see TONY pulling ropes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saving Valentina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (befuddled) What?... How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I overheard you. You only need one more to win. Me! I'll be that one. I'll take the risk to save Valentina and, hopefully, you sir. We've still got a few minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony steers DOCTOR PARNASSUS towards his glass column.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes! Of course! Of course! Thank God! Thank God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) How about thanking me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I expect nothing in return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to go into a trance) No. You're a saint... A saint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only Valentina's hand in marriage, if she'll have me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not listening) Oh, my head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, as your son-in-law... perhaps... initiation into the secrets of the trance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I can't do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... (realizing Parnassus is referring to his inability to go into a trance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?! What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mind... I can't concentrate... I'm too upset...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must do it! You have to do it! It's the only way to save your daughter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distraught)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting PARNASSUS down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concentrate. You must concentrate. (clearing the way to the mirror)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make the right choice. I'm sure of it. I can feel how right it is already. TONY leaps back to steady DR. PARNASSUS who looked as tho he were about to topple off his pillar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God!... Doctor... We can save her.. you and me. I need this. We both need this. Please. The trance. PARNASSUS quiets down.   Starts mumbling. TONY rushes to the mirror. Steps through. He finds himsel standing amongst the stage scenery. Nothing else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bugger! He steps back out of the mirror.    Goes to PARNASSUS who weeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no good!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TONY shakes him hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL YOURSELF TOGETHER!... Sir. Concentrate...or you'll have lost her forever. PARNASSUS slowly goes into a sobbing kind of trance state TONY confirms he is in a trance, then rushes to the mirro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony...oh, Tony.. What?! TONY stops. Looks around. There in the shadows huddles VALENTINA, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sobbing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's useless... Hopeless... I thought I was strong, but I don't even know how to run away... TONY hesitates.. No time! He looks back to PARNASSUS who seems to still be in his trance. Hesitates. Then rushes t VALENTINA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright... it's alright... Don't cry. It's going to be alright, believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stupid theatre...!... That's all I've ever known...! I've always believed it was something precious, but it's not... it's a lie...I hate it! TONY lifts her up, putting his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's going to be alright... I'll take you away. I'll show you the world. My world. The great big beautiful world I've always dreamed of... You'll love it. VALENTINA, grateful, clings to TONY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon then. They turn to the mirror but, an off-stage clearing of the throat makes them look round to see ANTON watching them. holding a torn and dirty piece of newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, there you are, Tony. Here's something m-might interest you. (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Missing: D-disgraced head of children's charity'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! TONY tries to snatch the paper but ANTON steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N-not a bad p-picture, Tony. Listen to this Valentina... it's about Tony's b-beautiful world..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentina!     Where are you? PARNASSUS is still in his trance but, mumbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Anthony Shepherd, who was arrested last week on charges of... VALENTINA is surrounded. Confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Valentina)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentina, Don't listen to that. I'm innocent. This is the work of people who are trying to destroy me! Evil people! Believe me! Look, I'll show you the truth! TONY pulls VALENTINA towards the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANTON tries to stop him, but TONY pushes him back, off th stage. He crashes to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing VALENTINA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry! TONY and VALENTINA disappear through the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sobbing in his trance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentina! Forgive me.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT DR. PARNASSUS' DRUNKEN IMAGINATION
dialogues.text: Mist and rain descend as TONY and VALENTINA run through t darkened shapes of the shampoo-commercial landscape - now tattered, ragged, and wind blown. Darkness reigns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't right. This is all wrong. Which way? Soaked and cold they spy a welcome sight. A uniformed val with an open umbrella stands by the door of a sleek limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your car is here, Mr.Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Lester, just in time. TONY ducks under the umbrella and helps VALENTINA into th car ahead of himself. As she slides across the seat she notices the driver - bo hatted and smoking a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Tony, don't get in! Get away! She pushes TONY back and scrambles out...dragging him bac out into the dark rain. The driver turns around.   It's MR.NICK.. looking vexed. VALENTINA and TONY struggle through the rain. Suddenly, t find themselves in deep water up to their chests. They ar sinking. Through the mist they see a boat. It is the gond that transported the LOUIS VUITTON LADY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! Over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boatman turns the boat in their direction. TONY tries pull himself on board. The boatman reaches down to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's MR. NICK.    VALENTINA recoils, drags TONY off the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! What are you doing!   We'll drown!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No we won't. This is the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to jumbled rocks just visible in the darkness. They drag themselves onto them. The rocky monoliths appea to be the same as the landscape ANTON climbed over when h was searching for DIEGO, the son of THE FAMILY FROM HELL. And, like a repeat of that experience, from behind the ri rises the Parnassus-faced Mongolfier balloon. But, now th eyes stream tears and rain pours down. In the basket is ANTON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't d-do it. Don't g-go on. Not with him! He's all lies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like my father. Leave me alone. I don't care anymore. I want a new life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentina...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls her away..towards a little tumble-down cottage. candlelight glows in the windows, smoke curls from the chimney. They run to the door. TONY bangs on it. Someone can be heard unlatching the locks inside. A child's crying cuts through the wind. VALENTINA turns and sees a little girl sitting on the pat among flapping laundry. She rushes to her, tries to pick up but, the little girl resists..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony, help me, she's heavy. The door has just opened and TONY is halfway through. turns, irritated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it now?! Can't we just go inside and get dry. Behind him, in the warmth, stands the old BABOUSHKA. Seeing that VALENTINA is really struggling with the littl girl, TONY reluctantly goes to help. The little girl, on seeing TONY, tries to break away but, he holds on to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting angrily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ostanobuite bas menshi schit! The litle girl goes quiet. VALENTINA looks at TONY with surprise. The BABOUSHKA looks angry. Suddenly a light beg to suffuse TONY and the little girl. A small orchestra ca be heard playing garden party music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did it! You made the right choice! The light fills the screen and we find... ...TONY, sleekly groomed and immaculately dressed, holdin the smiling little girl. She too has been cleaned and buffed. The sun shines. He stands in...

dialogues.speaker: EXT CHARITY GARDEN PARTY DAY
dialogues.text: ...a large well kept lawn covered with smart guests, BUSI PEOPLE, POLITICIANS, POP STARS, CELEBS... Behind and beyond them is an impressive country house. A small orchestra is playing. There is a marquee. WAITERS and WAITRESSES move amongst the assembled notable bearing trays of drinks and food. TONY is the focus of attention. A TV current-affairs/news JOURNALIST with CAMERA CREW is following him around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sustainability's great, if you can achieve it. The problem is, in many cases you simply can't, for a whole variety of reasons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY smiles and shakes the hand of someone in a wheelchai A GROUP OF GUESTS burst into spontaneous applause. Everyb loves and admires TONY. He smiles boyishly. He moves on. The TV CREW stay with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you running the risk of entrenching the need for charity by increasingly institutionalising it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, charity, like poor little Olga... (referring to the little girl) ...is always with us, to coin a phrase...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALENTINA appears. She is beautifully dressed, coiffed, m up, she looks stunning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to VALENTINA) Ah, there you are, my lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She and TONY exchange broad smiles. They're in love. He p her to his side and puts his arm around her. The photographers snap away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what's your message to the Prime Minister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs engagingly) I wouldn't presume to have a 'message' for the Prime Minister... Fortunately for the Foundation, I think we pretty much see eye to eye on most things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we hear a distant buzzing. EVERYBODY looks up.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They see a speck in the sky, it's the PRIME MINISTER'S approaching helicopter... TONY and the posse of JOURNALISTS and PHOTOGRAPHERS rush leaving VALENTINA standing alone.

dialogues.speaker: EXT HELICOPTER LANDING PAD DAY
dialogues.text: The PRIME MINISTER and his WIFE get out of the helicopter followed by their AIDES. TONY and the PRIME MINISTER shak hands for THE TV CAMERAS. VALENTINA watches from a distance..ignored.

dialogues.speaker: INT BALLROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: A huge chandelier illuminates a grand ornate ballroom whe wealthy guests, in evening dress, are being seated at tab by liveried ushers. Large beautiful photographs of the underprivileged children of the world line the walls. A great banner reads "Suffer The Little Children Benefit Ba The PRIME MINISTER and his WIFE are seated at the head ta facing the dais, bubbly and expectant. Security is heavy.

dialogues.speaker: INT ENTRANCE HALL NIGHT
dialogues.text: TONY is conferring with his speech writers and assistants VALENTINA descends the staircase looking utterly stunning a beautiful gown. TONY bows, romantically kissing her han He turns her to admire their reflections in a gilt mirror...the perfect, beautiful, dream couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look gorgeous, my love.   I knew you wouldn't let me down. The little girl, OLGA, and a little boy are brought forwa They are dressed in ethnic clothes. TONY takes OLGA'S hand...offers the little boy's hand to VALENTINA. She tak it in her own. The four of them start to walk to the door leading to the ballroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking to everyone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a vitally important moment for the future of the Foundation. The children of the world are depending on us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentina!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY and VALENTINA look around. ANTON is nowhere to be se but, his voice continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of this is false! It's nothing to do with you! It's all him. It's his imagination!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call security, somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all rotten! A naked lie! You've got to understand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LITTLE BOY is tugging VALENTINA'S arm.       She look It's ANTON. A child-size ANTON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He produces the newspaper with TONY'S photo and news stor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...`Tony Liar'..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   How?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY lunges for him but, ANTON dodges out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading and dodging) 'The disgraced director of the children's charity "Suffer the Little Children, who was arrested last..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security guards have rushed in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop him. Silence the little bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dodging the guards)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...who was arrested last week on charges of involvement in the sale of organs from third world children to wealthy Westerners'...unghh! TONY has grabbed little ANTON and starts hitting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now he doesn't stutter! You see!? It was all an act to get cheap sympathy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling TONY off ANTON)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your hands off him!! Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off me! What are you doing? (lashing out and hitting VALENTINA in the face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've betrayed me! Haven't you? You let him in...into my world, you bitch!?.. after all I've lavished on you...OW!! Little ANTON has leapt on TONY's back and sunk his teeth TONY'S ear. TONY throws him off and starts beating him.

dialogues.speaker: INT THE BALLROOM CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: In the glittering ballroom a children's choir sings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "We are the world..we are the children..." Behind the choir the double doors of the ballroom crash open... exposing TONY violently beating up an `ethnic chi Stunned silence as the horror of this happy scene sinks i Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God! Somebody stop him!   He's a monster! Get him! As one they leap to their feet.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TONY looks up and freezes. At the same time the walls of ballroom begin to crack and disintegrate. TONY'S world st to fall apart... literally. The floor around TONY falls away into an abyss leaving on narrow escape route. He hurls ANTON aside and dashes away the GUESTS pursue him. ANTON avoids being trampled but, loses his footing and falls over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALENTINA, fighting through the angry GUESTS, rushes to t edge of the abyss. ANTON is struggling to hold on to a broken floor joist that protrudes several feet down from side of the cliff face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentina!..help me. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His grip slips. VALENTINA reaches for him, grasps his han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me, Anton. I was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know... I'm not a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And.. ANTON REVERTS TO HIS NORMAL SIZE...AND WEIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Valentina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANTON slips out of her grip, plummeting into the abyss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, VALENTINA is jerked backwards by her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's behind this!? Eh!? You didn't come up with this all on your own did you!!!??? (slapping her) No! Someone's got at you. Someone's paid you!!!... Who!!!??? Tell me!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentina! My darling daughter! There you are!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They turn to see PARNASSUS in the distance (where once th ballroom stood) stumbling towards them, drunk, desperate. he moves forward a new landscape is created behind him. TONY rushes towards PARNASSUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You old bastard! This is all your doing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drunkenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All my doing?... I'm merely the facilititatater, dear boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is! Stop him! Leave her alone. Get him! Throwing his arm around TONY, PARNASSUS spins him around face the MOB rushing towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I create the opportunities. Is it my fault if your not up to it? Tony wrenches his arm free and violently shoves the drunk DOCTOR right into the path of the frenzied MOB. PARNASSUS trampled underfoot in their rush to catch TONY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father! No! PARNASSUS'S body lies broken on the ground. Frantically, VALENTINA rushes to him, throwing herself on her father's battered body, sobbing hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO..NO NO... Please.. father..it's all my fault. What have I done?... With siren wailing, an AMBULANCE arrives, screeching to a halt. PARAMEDICS pull VALENTINA away. They check PARNASSU for signs of life and begin to lift him onto the gurney. VALENTINA can't control herself and tries to throw hersel onto his body. The PARAMEDICS struggle with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a severe stutter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P-p-p-lease m-mis-s, there's-s n-n-othing y-y-y-you c-can d-d-o, he-he-he's d-d-dead...

dialogues.speaker: NOOOOO...
dialogues.text: VALENTINA wrenches herself out of their grasp howling lik animal and rushes away out of earshot before the PARAMEDI can finish speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...d-dead drunk. A bottle falls from the DOCTOR'S hand and explodes in a million fragments as it hits the ground. The shimmering fragments coalesce into a fractured mirror corridor down which a multi-reflected VALENTINA runs - sobbing like a madwoman - lashing out at her reflections, some of which are flashbacks of her flirting with TONY, irritated with ANTON, angry with PARNASSUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to her reflections)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little fool! You're to blame!.. for everything... I hate you! The multi-reflection broken mirror corridor ends at two mirrors identical to the one used in the Imaginarium. The to the left is marked 'His' with a bowler hat, the other the right 'Hers' with a bonnet. She hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing madly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is to be my choice!! MR NICK appears out of the "His" mirror - a burst of flam behind him. He makes a sweeping gesture inviting VALENTINA to enter t mirror marked 'Hers'. VALENTINA, heads for the mirror marked 'His'. MR NICK blo her path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, there's absolutely no need for that. That's just plain contrariness. VALENTINA tries to get around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you deserve punishment but you're a kid - you have no idea...trust me. VALENTINA feints another direction. MR NICK blocks her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a crazed look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong. I'm 16...I'm a woman now.. She spins around him...he blocks....a kind of dance betwe them begins - confusingly reflected in the mirrors. A tan can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a selfish bitch, everyone I love dies...I'm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...only fit for hell? If only. He looks at Valentina with lascivious intent. He's tempte briefly, but resists it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... your pop would never speak to me again. And that'd be a shame. Let's dance. Reflected in the swirling mirror fragments, they tango un he spins her towards the right hand mirror. She sails thr - and, with a mad smile, throws him a kiss. The mirror closes with a burst of flame. The briefest fla of DR. PARNASSUS face is reflected in the mirror fragment

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentina!!!!!! MR NICK turns, realizing he has been looking into a mirro fragment reflecting the two mirrors. The writing on the Valentina's mirror reads "His".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn!... I've won.

dialogues.speaker: EXT STRANGE MOUNTAIN LANDSCAPE
dialogues.text: DR. PARNASSUS is sitting alone on a prominent bluff (the one he tried throwing himself off many years ago) He's distraught. Tears run down this cheeks. A distant bell to midnight. MR NICK appears behind PARNASSUS...sits down beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny how things work out, isn't it? He lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not what I had in mind y'know... this.. Valentina, being the fifth... It doesn't seem right... She's supposed to be the prize, the star prize... not part of the bloody score... And you lumbered with eternal life all over again... What a bummer, eh? No response from PARNASSUS. A Tarot cards drops from his hand. It is The Hanged Man. MR. NICK points to the plain far below. Across the harsh ground, TONY is running for his life...pursued by the MOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope they get that bastard. Tear him limb from limb... But they won't... He leads a charmed life, that one... I've been trying to nail him for years... I thought I had him this time. But, there's always some prat comes to his rescue... Talk about the luck of the Devil. (he laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those weird markings you found on him... on his forehead... Those satanic-symbol, so-called, things... What's all that about?... Maybe they protect him in some way... I've never been into that black-magic stuff myself... Can't seem to get the hang of it... I know, pathetic isn't it?...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PARNASSUS ignores him, sunk even deeper into despondency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I hate to see you like this. Look, I tell you what... If you can get the lowdown on those satanic markings, or.. wait.. better still, if you can wipe that self- righteous little creep off the face of the universe... I'll give you Valentina back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Slowly, PARNASSUS looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about it?

dialogues.speaker: EXT SOMEWHERE ON THE MOUNTAIN
dialogues.text: TONY, sweating, panting for breath, is running up the mountain. Below, the MOB is still in hot pursuit. TONY reaches the summit. In front of him, is his salvatio an empty gibbet. A noose hangs from the crossbeam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God for that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY relaxes a little. We can hear the mob now, struggling up the mountain. TONY digs into one of his pockets and pulls out the brass tube that he has always kept close. TONY opens his mouth and is about to slip the tube down h throat when he spots the Hanged Man Tarot card lying at h feet. A hand from behind him snatches the tube away. TONY, startled, turns to find himself looking up at DR. PARNASSUS. PARNASSUS is standing on a chair with the noose around hi neck. He smiles and opens his hand. The metal tube has vanished. TONY panics. The MOB is getting closer.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: With his other hand DR. PARNASSUS produces the tube from TONY'S ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate) Give me that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. PARNASSUS gestures at the CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us a moment, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CROWD goes into very slow motion...but twice as angry DR. PARNASSUS teases TONY with magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your tube... Here's mine. (producing a second tube) But mine's just a cheap counterfeit... Look, it breaks... (he breaks it) But here's another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not amused?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate) You've been talking to the devil, haven't you? Let me guess what he said... If you manage to kill me, he'll release Valentina. Yes? Am I right?... I am aren't I? It's all lies. He can't release her. And why not? Because he doesn't have her. He can't have her because she's the prize. (gaining confidence) He doesn't have five wins. But if you kill me he will, won't he? You'll have lost Valentina forever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. PARNASSUS does a double hand shuffle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choose! TONY chooses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to believe me! For all our sakes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you made the right choice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's find out. He slides the tube down his throat and kicks the chair aw He drops... dangles from the rope...the noose tight aroun his neck. At the same moment, the MOB resumes normal speed and roar the mountain. Is PARNASSUS dead? Working very fast, TONY hoists him over his shoulder and wrestles the noose loose. He drops PARNASSUS on the groun He's stunned but still alive. The MOB is closing in. TONY slaps DR. PARNASSUS hard between the shoulder blades The tube pops out of the DOCTOR'S gullet. TONY catches it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotcha! TONY swallows the tube as the MOB surge around the gibbet grabbing him, beating him, and then lifting him onto the chair, tightening the noose around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Although battered, TONY winks smugly at DR. PARNASSUS, bu his mood changes when he sees DR. PARNASSUS spit out seve more fake tubes, then, gagging, force the real one up and of his gullet. With a look of realization and horror, TONY drops to his death as the MOB kicks the chair away from under him. The MOB cheers. Yes, he's dead. DR. PARNASSUS tosses the metal tube to MR NICK who steps coolly out of the MOB, cigarette in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarsely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are three cardinal rules. One, there's no black-magic, only cheap tricks. And... er... I forget the others. Now, where's my daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How should I know? You're her father. (with needle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her loving father. DR PARNASSUS looks askance at MR NICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's free... isn't she? MR NICK smiles and blows smoke in PARNASSUS'S face. The s fills the screen and becomes...

dialogues.speaker: EXT DESERT DAY
dialogues.text: ... a dust storm. The wind is howling. The swirling dust thins to reveal DR.PARNASSUS, alone, exhausted, trudging across a vast desert. He's tormented by his thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else could I do, Valentina? What else could I have done... What other choice could I have made?... Damn!... It was the right choice... Of course it was... Of course... But where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my beautiful daughter? Where's my darling? How long must I suffer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no proper road, only endless sand, but neverthel DR. PARNASSUS reaches a signpost which indicates two dist paths. One leads to a tidy little suburban home, the other up an dramatic mountain pass via a painfully steep staircase cu into the rock (the same one that MARTIN THE DRUNK chose n to climb days earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no... No more choices, please... No more choices...!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enraged, he tries to push the sign over, but is too feebl Exhausted, he subsides onto a smooth protruding stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. PARNASSUS, alarmed, rolls quickly off the stone. Now on his knees he finds himself looking at the top half PERCY'S head and face. What he'd thought was a stone was, fact, his old companion buried in the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. PARNASSUS, overjoyed, begins to dig PERCY out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About bloody time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated) Here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long's a piece of string? Don't ask daft questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God I found you. I need your advice. (indicating sign)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a problematical choice to make.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Problematical my arse! Come on... I know it's against the grain... PERCY grabs DR. PARNASSUS'S cloak and begins to pull him across the sand in the direction of the bungalow. We can see the sign reads `Easy'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on his dignity)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Suburban bungalows and all that they evoke are anathema to me. Dammit Percy! Stop! I've got my pride!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it goes just before the fall. PERCY grabs DR. PARNASSUS'S cloak and begins to pull him across the sand in the direction indicated by the sign wh we can now see reads 'Easy'..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on... I know it's against the grain...

dialogues.speaker: EXT SUBURBAN BUNGALOW
dialogues.text: PERCY pulls the reluctant DR. PARNASSUS up the drive of a suburban bungalow, past a perfect lawn and double garage, the front door. PERCY rings the bell. DR. PARNASSUS tries to make a run for it but PERCY holds fast. The door is opened by VALENTINA. She's older and is carry a BABY in her arms. Both DR. PARNASSUS and VALENTINA are astonished. Neither knows what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentina...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father...? (recovering) Where have you been?... All these years... I thought you were dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did I. But you... I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALENTINA steps back and ushers her father in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside) So far, so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PERCY is about to follow, but VALENTINA, focussing on her father, closes the door in his face.

dialogues.speaker: INT SUBURBAN BUNGALOW
dialogues.text: VALENTINA shows DR. PARNASSUS into the sitting-room. He s on the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mummy? Can I have some ice-cream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SMALL BOY enters from the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mummy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy, this is your grandad. Say hello to your grandad. (to Parnassus) I think he looks a little like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY takes one look at DR. PARNASSUS and runs back into kitchen. VALENTINA laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's only five. And he's very shy. Would you like some tea?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DR. PARNASSUS nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you look after Imogen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's eight months, and, so far, fortunately, doesn't look in the least like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. PARNASSUS is moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all I ever wanted... I know it's not what you wanted for me, but...well... there you go... I'm happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANTON enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his arm around VALENTINA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're both happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. PARNASSUS doesn't know what to say. He sits there, a ragged old man with a baby on his knee, tears streaming d his face.

dialogues.speaker: EXT RAILWAY STATION CENTRAL LONDON
dialogues.text: Little cut-out cardboard figures are 'performing' in a to theatre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your choice. You can stay here and look after mum and dad, or come with me and help fight the giant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA pulls back to show PERCY manipulating the pupp and giving them voices. He and DR. PARNASSUS are running stall selling toy theatres. Business is good.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The audience is made up of mainly KIDS, with some ADULTS. COMMUTERS come and go. A COUPLE OF PARENTS purchase a theatre for their son. DR. PARNASSUS takes the money and expertly wraps the theatre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautifully made. It'll last for years if properly looked after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it come with a happy ending?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid we can't guarantee that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA angles across the table... In a shadowy corner stands MR NICK, smoking a cigarette.
